analysis.Summary: This SCSS file defines a comprehensive set of utility classes for setting background colors, transparent overlays, blur effects, gradients, video backgrounds, and SVG fills using CSS custom properties and standard CSS functions.
analysis.Purpose: To centralize and standardize all background- and fill-related utility classes across the application, leveraging CSS variables for theming and consistency.

Components.name: Background Color Utilities
Components.description: Solid background colors based on CSS custom properties.

Components.name: Background Social Color Utilities
Components.description: Solid backgrounds for social brand colors via CSS variables.

Components.name: BG Blur Utilities
Components.description: Backdrop-filter blur effects with variable blur radii.

Components.name: Other Backgrounds
Components.description: Radial gradient background combining CSS variables and hardcoded stops.

Components.name: Transparent Backgrounds
Components.description: Semi-transparent or fully transparent overlays using rgba and CSS variables.

Components.name: Video Background
Components.description: Full-screen, absolutely positioned video container with object-fit: cover.

Components.name: Fill Utilities
Components.description: SVG/currentColor fill utility classes referencing CSS variables or hardcoded hex values.

Components.name: Color Fills
Components.description: Static color fill utilities (including a linear-gradient entry).

Components.name: Brand Fills
Components.description: SVG fill utilities for social brand colors via CSS variables.

Functions.name: rgb()
Functions.description: Applies RGB color from CSS variable triplets (e.g. var(--red)).

Functions.name: rgba()
Functions.description: Applies RGBA color with opacity from CSS variables and numeric alpha parameter.

Functions.name: radial-gradient()
Functions.description: Generates a radial gradient for .bg-grad-main combining variable and hardcoded color stops.

Functions.name: linear-gradient()
Functions.description: Used in .fill-lightblue to produce a layered gradient fill.

Functions.name: backdrop-filter: blur()
Functions.description: Applies blur effect to element backgrounds with variable radii.

Dependencies: A variables or theme file that defines CSS custom properties (--red, --green, --orange, --youtube, --blur sizes, etc.)
Global reset/base styles that include this file
Browser support for CSS variables and backdrop-filter
analysis.Usage: Imported into the global or base SCSS entrypoint (e.g. main.scss) via @import or @use. Makes background/fill utilities available project-wide.
Notes: No SCSS mixins or functions are declared here; it relies entirely on CSS variables and native CSS functions.
The nested body { … } wrapper scopes selectors under the body element, but classes remain universally reusable.
Two semicolons appear on .fill-white declaration—harmless but could be cleaned up.
.fill-lightblue uses a linear-gradient in a fill property which may not be supported in all SVG contexts.
Variable names for orange were corrected in comments, suggesting an earlier naming inconsistency.
